meanings.definition: (verb) To flow or leak slowly in a continuous stream.
meanings.sent1: The wound was oozing blood after the accident.
meanings.sent2: The syrup was oozing out of the bottle.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet kept oozing water, making a small puddle on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness oozed out of every gesture she made.
meanings.sent5: The lava oozing from the volcano painted a fiery path down the mountainside.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Showing a slow flow or leakage.
meanings.sent1: The oozing wound needed immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: The oozing sap made the tree trunk sticky to touch.
meanings.sent3: The oozing chocolate on the cake looked tempting to the kids.
meanings.sent4: The oozing paint created a messy pattern on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The oozing mud made the path slippery and hard to walk on.

meanings.definition: (noun) The act of flowing or leaking slowly.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noticed the oozing from the wound and applied a bandage.
meanings.sent2: The slow oozing of the water from the pipe caused a small flood in the basement.
meanings.sent3: The oozing of emotions during the movie made everyone tear up.
meanings.sent4: The oozing of information from the leak raised concerns about privacy.
meanings.sent5: The oozing of honey from the jar was a sweet sight for the children.
